a1: Most failures are due to CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) restrictions. The API server must include appropriate CORS headers to allow browser requests.
a2: GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, and OPTIONS are all supported.
a3: Yes, set the Content-Type header to application/json and enter your JSON in the request body for POST, PUT, or PATCH requests.
a4: All requests are made directly from your browser to the API endpoint. No data passes through our servers.
